description.full:
A report containing statistical information about the flow of media with the latest live statistics.

This is a plugin for respoke. To leverage it, include <script src="https://cdn.respoke.io/respoke-stats.min.js"></script>.

The plugin adds the methods getStats() and stopStats() to respoke.Call.

Usage

Once you have a Call instance after endpoint.startCall() or in the client.on('call') / new Client({ onCall: yourCallHandler }) event listener:

using callbacks

 call.getStats({
     onStats: function continualStatsHandler(evt) { . . . },
     onSuccess: yourOnSuccessHandler,
     onError: yourOnErrorHandler 
 });

or using a promise

 call.getStats({
     onStats: function continualStatsHandler(evt) { . . . },
 }).done(onSuccess, onFailure);
description.summary: A report containing statistical information about the flow of media with the latest live statistics.
description.body:
This is a plugin for respoke. To leverage it, include <script src="https://cdn.respoke.io/respoke-stats.min.js"></script>.

The plugin adds the methods getStats() and stopStats() to respoke.Call.

Usage

Once you have a Call instance after endpoint.startCall() or in the client.on('call') / new Client({ onCall: yourCallHandler }) event listener:

using callbacks

 call.getStats({
     onStats: function continualStatsHandler(evt) { . . . },
     onSuccess: yourOnSuccessHandler,
     onError: yourOnErrorHandler 
 });

or using a promise

 call.getStats({
     onStats: function continualStatsHandler(evt) { . . . },
 }).done(onSuccess, onFailure);

tags.name: channelId
tags.description:
- A string which identifies this media stream (which may contain several
media stream tracks) to the browser.

tags.name: foundIncomingNetworkPaths
tags.description:
- Whether or not the ICE hole-punching process has found
a suitable network path from the remote party to this client.

tags.name: foundOutgoingNetworkPaths
tags.description:
- Whether or not the ICE hole-punching process has found
a suitable network path from this client to the remote party.

tags.name: localHost
tags.description: - The local IP and port number of the media connection.

tags.name: remoteHost
tags.description: - The remote IP and port number of the media connection.

tags.name: localMediaPath
tags.description:
- The type of network path the local media is taking to the remote
party, one of "local", "srflx", "prflx", "relay".

tags.name: remoteMediaPath
tags.description:
- The type of network path the local media is taking to the remote
party, one of "local", "srflx", "prflx", "relay".

tags.name: roundTripTime
tags.description: - How long it takes media packets to traverse the network path.

tags.name: transport
tags.description: - Whether the media is flowing via UDP or TCP

description.full: Information about the connection.
description.summary: Information about the connection.

tags.name: audioInputLevel
tags.description: - Microphone volume.

tags.name: codec
tags.description: - Audio codec in use.

tags.name: totalBytesSent
tags.description: - Total number of bytes sent since media first began flowing.

tags.name: periodBytesSent
tags.description: - Number of bytes sent since the last stats event.

tags.name: totalPacketsSent
tags.description: - Total number of packets sent since media first began flowing.

tags.name: periodPacketsSent
tags.description: - Number of packets sent since the last stats event.

tags.name: transportId
tags.description: - The identifer of the media stream to which this media stream track belongs.

description.full:
The data you get out of getStats needs some pruning and a tidy up so I define some things I think are 'interesting' and how to find them.

getStats gives you an array of results each of which has a type. Each result contains a list of keys and a dictionary of values that can be retrieved by key. (no ,they aren't properties)

The interesting stats object is a list of objects, each describing the type of result that contains the stats, the names of the relevant stats and a way to filter out the irrelevant results objects of the same type.

An added complication is that the standards are in flux so google add data in chrome (some of it useful) that isn;t in the draft standard.
description.summary: The data you get out of getStats needs some pruning and a tidy up so I define some things I think are 'interesting' and how to find them.
description.body:

An added complication is that the standards are in flux so google add data in chrome (some of it useful) that isn;t in the draft standard.
